verb.description: (of a fish, frog, mollusk, crustacean, etc.) release or deposit eggs.
examples: the fish spawn among fine-leaved plants
why had she married a man who could spawn a boy like that?

noun.description: The eggs of fish, frogs, etc.
examples: the fish covers its spawn with gravel

noun.description: The product or offspring of a person or place (used to express distaste or disgust)
examples: the spawn of chaos: demons and sorcerers

noun.description: The mycelium of a fungus, especially a cultivated mushroom.

origin: Late Middle English: shortening of Anglo-Norman French espaundre to shed roe, variant of Old French espandre pour out, from Latin expandere expand.
